questions.question: What is the time complexity of building a heap of n elements using the optimal bottom-up heapify method?
In a red-black tree, which of the following properties ensures logarithmic height?
options: No two consecutive red nodes on any path
All leaves are at same depth
Every node has equal left and right subtrees
Root must always be black and have two children

questions.question: What is the amortized time complexity of inserting an element into a dynamic array (like C++ vector) when doubling strategy is used?
Which algorithm is used to find strongly connected components in a directed graph?
Which data structure gives the most efficient implementation of LRU cache?
What is the worst-case time complexity of QuickSort when always choosing the first element as pivot?
Which of the following scheduling algorithms can cause starvation?
In TCP, which flag is set in the first step of the three-way handshake?
Which normal form eliminates multivalued dependencies?
If an undirected graph has n vertices and n edges, it must contain:
Which algorithm is optimal for finding the minimum spanning tree in a sparse graph?
What is the worst-case time complexity of searching in a skip list with n elements?
Which of the following concurrency control techniques uses timestamps to order transactions?
In a B+ tree of order m, what is the maximum number of keys a node (except root) can contain?
Which of the following is true about the 'volatile' keyword in C/C++?
options: Tells compiler variable can be optimized
Tells compiler variable can be modified externally, so no optimization

questions.question: Which page replacement algorithm may suffer from Belady's anomaly?
Which hashing technique resolves collisions by creating a linked list at each bucket?
What is the worst-case time complexity of building a suffix array using the naive approach for a string of length n?
Which type of lock allows multiple readers but only one writer at a time?
Which of these algorithms solves the All-Pairs Shortest Path problem?
For a disjoint set union (Union-Find) with union by rank and path compression, what is the amortized time complexity of each operation?
options: O(α(n)) where α is inverse Ackermann

questions.question: In a suffix automaton of a string of length n, what is the maximum number of states?
What is the time complexity of Tarjan’s algorithm for finding articulation points in a graph with n vertices and m edges?
Which of the following algorithms can detect negative weight cycles and also compute shortest paths?
When implementing a concurrent hash map, which technique reduces contention on the table?
In persistent segment trees, what is the memory complexity per update for n elements?
Which algorithm finds the maximum matching in a general graph?
Which of the following statements about skip lists is correct?
options: Expected search time is O(log n) but worst-case is O(n)
Skip lists cannot be used as priority queues

questions.question: Which of these statements about B-Trees and B+ Trees is true?
options: In B+ Trees, internal nodes store data values
In B-Trees, leaf nodes are linked in a linked list
B+ Trees store all keys at leaf level with linked leaves
B+ Trees cannot handle range queries efficiently

questions.question: The maximum number of edges in a simple undirected planar graph with n≥3 vertices is:
In a multi-threaded program, which concurrency control avoids both deadlock and starvation by ordering resource acquisition?
What is the best achievable time complexity for median of medians selection algorithm?
Which of the following describes the CAP theorem correctly?
options: You can have Consistency and Availability but not Partition Tolerance
It’s impossible to guarantee all three: Consistency, Availability, and Partition Tolerance simultaneously
CAP applies only to relational databases

questions.question: Which approach does NOT prevent SQL injection?
options: Using prepared statements with bound parameters
Escaping quotes manually in query strings

questions.question: In a consistent hashing ring with k virtual nodes per physical node, adding a new node affects approximately what fraction of keys?
options: 1/n of total keys where n is number of nodes

questions.question: What is the time complexity of building a suffix tree using Ukkonen’s algorithm for a string of length n?
Which garbage collection algorithm divides the heap into multiple regions and collects short-lived objects more frequently?
In a trie storing m strings of average length L, what is the worst-case space complexity?
Which of the following encryption algorithms is asymmetric?
In Paxos consensus protocol, which component proposes values?
Which one of the following algorithms solves the maximum subarray sum problem in O(n) time?
Which of the following scheduling algorithms minimizes average waiting time if all jobs arrive at time zero?
What is the asymptotic upper bound on height of an AVL tree with n nodes?
Which of the following data structures can be used to implement a priority queue with decrease-key in O(log n)?
In a Bloom filter with k hash functions and m bits storing n elements, what is the approximate false positive probability?
Which file allocation method suffers most from external fragmentation?
In database systems, which isolation level can lead to phantom reads?
Which concurrency control algorithm allows multiple versions of data items?
What is the time complexity of Dijkstra’s algorithm using a Fibonacci heap with n vertices and m edges?
Which data structure is used in the Aho-Corasick algorithm for multiple pattern matching?
